intro: Rhododendron flavidum var. flavidum, commonly known as the yellow rhododendron, is a species native to the eastern Himalayas. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its clusters of yellow to golden-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy appearance. This variety is valued for its ornamental value in gardens and its role in ecological habitats.
